page.title: 01ST MARYS TRAINING COLLEGE
page.content: St Marys Roman Catholic College in STRAWBERRY HILL near Twickenham was founded in Hammersmith in 1850. It was moved to its present site in 1925. The former owner was a descendant of Horace Walpole whose keen interest in medieval architecture is prominent throughout the house. The most recent building project was completed in 1962 and consisted of three new halls. The college motto is MONSTRATE ESSE MATREM meaning BE A MOTHER TO US. At present there is a staff of 120 and 1300 students, 400 of whom live on the campus. The college offers a wide range of courses in science, arts and humanities right up to degree level and beyond. Sports played by students include karate, rugby, hockey, cricket, netball, tennis, surfing and football. ARCHDEACON CAMBRIDGE SCHOOL
